gurmukhi: ਜਬ ਅਾਕਰਖ; ਕਰਤ ਹੋ ਕਬਹੂੰ ॥ ਤੁਮ ਮੈਂ ਮਿਲਤ; ਦੇਹ ਧਰ ਸਭਹੂੰ ॥੧੩॥
transliteration: Jab Aakarakh Karat Ho Kab-hoon|| Toum Mai Milat Deh Dhar Sabh-hoon||389||
translation: When at any time He withdraws His creation, all the physical forms are merged in Him.389.

gurmukhi: ਜੇਤੇ ਬਦਨ; ਸਿ੍ਰਸਟਿ ਸਭ ਧਾਰੈ ॥ ਅਾਪੁ ਅਾਪਨੀ ਬੂਝਿ; ੳੁਚਾਰੈ ॥
transliteration: Jete Badan Srishttee Sabh Ddareeai|| Aap(u) Aapouniboodhe(i) Oucdareeai||
translation: All the bodies of living beings created in the world speak about Him according to their understanding;

gurmukhi: ਤੁਮ ਸਭ ਹੀ ਤੇ; ਰਹਤ ਨਿਰਾਲਮ ॥ ਜਾਨਤ ਬੇਦ ਭੇਦ; ਅਰੁ ਅਾਲਮ ॥੧੪॥
transliteration: Toum Sabh Hite Rahat Niraalam|| Jaanat Bed Bhed Ar(u) Aalam||390||
translation: But Thou, O Lord ! live quite apart form everything; this fact is know to the Vedas and the learned.390.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰ ਨਿ੍ਰਬਿਕਾਰ; ਨਿ੍ਰਲੰਭ ॥ ਅਾਦਿ ਅਨੀਲ; ਅਨਾਦਿ ਅਸੰਭ ॥
transliteration: Nirankaar Nribikaar Nrilanbh|| Aadh Anil Anaadh Asanbh||
translation: The Lord is Formless, Sinless and shelterless: He is the Primal Power, Blemishlless, Behinningless and Unborn;

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਕਾ; ਮੂੜ੍ਹ ੳੁਚਾਰਤ ਭੇਦਾ ॥ ਜਾ ਕੋ ਭੇਵ; ਨ ਪਾਵਤ ਬੇਦਾ ॥੧੫॥
transliteration: Taakaa Moondh Ouchaarat Bhedaa|| Jaako Bhev Na Paavat Bedaa||391||
translation: The fool claims boastfully about the knowledge of His secrets, which even the Vedas do not know.391.

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਕੌ; ਕਰਿ ਪਾਹਨ ਅਨੁਮਾਨਤ ॥ ਮਹਾ ਮੂੜ੍ਹ; ਕਛੁ ਭੇਦ ਨ ਜਾਨਤ ॥
transliteration: Taakan Kar(i) Paahan Anoumaanat|| Mahaan Moondh Kachh(u) Bhed Na Jaanat||
translation: The fool considers Him a stone, but the great fool does not know any secret;

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾਂਦੇਵ ਕੌ; ਕਹਤ ਸਦਾ ਸਿਵ ॥ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰ ਕਾ; ਚੀਨਤ ਨਹਿ ਭਿਵ ॥੧੬॥
transliteration: Mahaandev Kau Kahat Sadaa Shiv|| Nirankar Kaa Cheenat Nah(i) Bhiv||392||
translation: He calls Shiva “The Eternal Lord, “but he does not know the secret of the Formless Lord.392.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪੁ ਅਾਪੁਨੀ; ਬੁਧਿ ਹੈ ਜੇਤੀ ॥ ਬਰਨਤ ਭਿੰਨ ਭਿੰਨ; ਤੁਹਿ ਤੇਤੀ ॥
transliteration: Aap(i) Aapounibudh(i) Hai Jetee|| Barnat Bhinn Bhinn Tuhe Tetee||
translation: According to one;s won intellect, one describes Thee differently;

gurmukhi: ਤੁਮਰਾ ਲਖਾ ਨ ਜਾੲਿ; ਪਸਾਰਾ ॥ ਕਿਹ ਬਿਧਿ ਸਜਾ; ਪ੍ਰਥਮ ਸੰਸਾਰਾ ॥੧੭॥
transliteration: Toumraa Lakhaa Naa Jaae Pasaaraa|| Kih Bidh(i) Sajaa Pratham Sansaaraa||393||
translation: The limits of Thy creation cannot be known and how the world was fashioned in the beginning?393.

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕੈ ਰੂਪ; ਅਨੂਪ ਸਰੂਪਾ ॥ ਰੰਕ ਭਯੋ; ਰਾਵ ਕਹੀ ਭੂਪਾ ॥
transliteration: Ekai Roop Anoop Daroopaa|| Rank Bhayo Raav Kaheen Bhoopaa||
translation: He hath only one unparalleled Form; He manifests Himself as a poor man or a king at different places;

gurmukhi: ਅੰਡਜ ਜੇਰਜ; ਸੇਤਜ ਕੀਨੀ ॥ ੳੁਤਭੁਜ ਖਾਨਿ; ਬਹੁਰਿ ਰਚਿ ਦੀਨੀ ॥੧੮॥
transliteration: Anndaj Jeraj Setaj Keenee|| Outbhuj Khaan(i) Bahur(i) Rach(i) Deenee||394||
translation: He created creatures from eggs, wombs and perspiration; then He created the vegetable kingdom.394.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਫੂਲਿ; ਰਾਜਾ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਬੈਠਾ ॥ ਕਹੂੰ ਸਿਮਟਿ; ਭਯੋ ਸੰਕਰ ੲਿਕੈਠਾ ॥
transliteration: Kahoon Puool(i) Raajaa Hvai Baithaa|| Kahoon Simattee Bhayo Shankar Ikaithaa||
translation: Somewhere He sits joyfully as a king; somewhere He contracts Himself as Shiva, the Yogi;

gurmukhi: ਸਿਗਰੀ ਸਿ੍ਰਸਟਿ; ਦਿਖਾੲਿ ਅਚੰਭਵ ॥ ਅਾਦਿ ਜੁਗਾਦਿ; ਸਰੂਪ ਸੁਯੰਭਵ ॥੧੯॥
transliteration: Sagrisrishttee Dikhaae Achanndhav|| Aadh Jougaddh Saroop Suyanbhav||395||
translation: All His creation unfolds wonderful things; He, the Primal Power, is from the beginning and Self-Existent.395.

gurmukhi: ਅਬ ਰੱਛਾ ਮੇਰੀ; ਤੁਮ ਕਰੋ ॥ ਸਿੱਖÎ ੳੁਬਾਰਿ; ਅਸਿੱਖÎ ਸੰਘਰੋ ॥
transliteration: Ab Rachchhaadmeritoumdaro|| Sikkhya Udaar(i) Assikkhya Sanhro||
translation: O Lord ! keep me now under Thy protection; protect my disciples and destroy my enemies;
